intro: Bellis major, commonly known as the common daisy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and numerous yellow-centered white flowers that bloom from spring to autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are composed of ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular florets, which are pollinated by insects. Bellis major is often found in meadows, lawns, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its hardy and easy-to-grow nature.
